intro: Caliphruria hartwegiana, commonly known as the Hartweg's lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its pale to dark green thallus with a distinctive, finely granular texture. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae and fungi, which contribute to its ability to thrive in various environmental conditions. It is typically found on bark, stones, and soil in temperate and subarctic regions. Caliphruria hartwegiana is often used in ecological studies to monitor air quality due to its sensitivity to pollutants.
